abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Credit
            Project will support a set of reforms directed at reaching
            the following objectives: to increase confidence in the
            banking system and resource mobilization; to strengthen the
            financial condition of banks; and to reduce the high cost of
            credit. The reforms include : (a) maintenance of a coherent
            macreconomic policy aimed at continued stability; (b)
            strengthening banking supervision; (c) continuation of
            market determination of interest rates; and (d) improving
            banking regulations including more stringent regulations on
            loan portfolio classification, provision for loan losses,
            and on interest accruals on problem loans. These reforms
            further include; requiring external audits of banks by
            qualified auditors; (a) establishment of an adequate
            mechanism to handle problem banks; (b) resolving the
            "dedollarization" issue; (c) compensating banks
            for their reserve requirements; (d) rehabilitation or
            restructuring of public financial institutions; and (e)
            strengthening the Central Bank of Bolivia.
